messages: a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (06:22): was going to tell variable that for rationale on why that was dropped, he should look for message with implementor feedback from David Hyatt
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (06:23): and maybe messages from last July or August from Adrian Bateman
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (06:23): and Hixie did post a message at the time that was dropped, explaining the rationale for not including it at this time
c9c91d70d978f16fd2146644f2030d54 (06:30): any chanse that HTML5 <video> will get playlist support?
e2633ed61085592add6e058692dfff2f (06:33): c9c91d70d978f16fd2146644f2030d54, comment out in the WHATWG spec is the "proposed v2 (actually v3!) features:"
e2633ed61085592add6e058692dfff2f (06:34): c9c91d70d978f16fd2146644f2030d54, and playlists is part of that: "playlists, with the ability to get metadata out of them (e.g. xspf)"
e2633ed61085592add6e058692dfff2f (06:34): just a mention of it
e2633ed61085592add6e058692dfff2f (06:35): c9c91d70d978f16fd2146644f2030d54, view source on that page
c9c91d70d978f16fd2146644f2030d54 (06:36): nvm, it's on that page :P
c9c91d70d978f16fd2146644f2030d54 (06:37): what filetype should a <track type="captions"> be?
c9c91d70d978f16fd2146644f2030d54 (06:41): is it supported by any browsers?
e2633ed61085592add6e058692dfff2f (06:42): most usage of subtitles and captions in html5 video uses javascript
e2633ed61085592add6e058692dfff2f (06:43): c9c91d70d978f16fd2146644f2030d54, see here for example: http://www.bluishcoder.co.nz/2008/12/srt-subtitles-with-html5-video.html

c9c91d70d978f16fd2146644f2030d54 (06:43): well, once it's supported in WebKit, I'll write a JS parser to convert YouTube captions to WebSRT's, and add a <track> automagically to my <video> with a data: URL to the autocreated SRT
c9c91d70d978f16fd2146644f2030d54 (06:44): is impressed by his own download count
